page.title: 06Tourist Attractions
page.content: In this area there are many attractions for the tourist. Walking in the area is varied as there are hills on one side of the road,the B3139,and lowland moors on the other. The road itself was originally a Turnpike Trust which connected with the railway at Highbridge and it now runs to Burnham-on-Sea,a popular seaside resort. Since Burnham is only about 15 miles from the Wookey to Bleadney area it is easily accessible to tourists staying there. The other major attraction for tourists staying in this area is the Cheddar Gorge which is about 10 miles away.It is the nearest thing in Great Britain to a canyon and is extremely impressive. It also contains some splendid show caves.
